body:
@jbduncan can you verify whether the jupiter-testjar.jar file actually exists?

On a first quick look it seems  somewhere we have a problem handling spaces in paths.

Hi @gaganis. Yes, I can verify that that jar exists, but only if I replace the `%20` in the path with a normal space before entering it into Windows Explorer. Otherwise, Windows throws a bit of a hissy fit.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2482228/23825517/2fde5a2a-0683-11e7-9b73-54b1e8026ef3.png)

Screenshot of it working successfully once I enter the parent path of the jar, `%20` replaced with space, into Windows Explorer:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2482228/23825557/e93901b4-0683-11e7-99eb-4763ed2fa580.png)

I have managed to replicate it also on my system running linux. Just moving the project under a path that contains a space makes it break.

Good catch @jbduncan!

issue.title: Properly decode jar file URI with spaces in its path

milestone.title: 5.0 M4
milestone.description: Themes: test templates, repeated tests, and parameterized tests.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Fixes #726 by using single String-consuming URI constructor that properly decodes paths, even when they contain escaped characters like `%20` for spaces.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

body: Thanks @jbduncan and @gaganis for the detailed report!
NP @sormuras This was was fixed blazingly fast!
